metadata.synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
11.text: I thought you were going to save him, but you abused his current state to get rid of him!

62.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
62.text: As long as I breathe, you will not take another step in this city!

58.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: I have saved countless lives. I am still the man you thought I was.

84.speaker: Wyll
84.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: Mizora lied to you. I wanted to save my father, and the devil sabotaged me.

82.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
82.text: Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

105.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
105.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

42.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
42.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

36.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
36.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

127.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
127.text: Since then the city faced countless threats - but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. But this time, things are different.

81.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
81.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - We need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

122.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
122.text: The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

116.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
116.text: Let it set the path before you.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

22.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
22.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

26.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
26.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

97.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
97.text: May your father's courage be with you, Wyll. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

24.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
24.text: Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.

31.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
31.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: Your faith in me is well-founded. I will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

103.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
103.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

129.speaker: Wyll
129.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

39.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
39.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: Let the dragon sleep. I'll deal with the Absolute on my own terms.

67.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
67.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
30.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you prize his ways, you'll seek out the wyrm.

17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
17.text: I will go and assemble any allies I can find. When the battle horns call, we'll stand ready.

50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
50.text: Unleash the wyrm, Wyll - let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. Good luck!

6.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
6.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

19.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
19.text: Your father gave it to me, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.

135.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
135.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. Each of them will soon be put to the test.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

45.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

21.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
21.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

99.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
99.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *The stories of Elturel's fall come to mind. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and your father along with it. He knew all too well how infernal machinations worked.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *The stories of Elturel's fall come to mind. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and your father along with it. He knew all too well how infernal machinations worked.*

65.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
65.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

87.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
87.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

14.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

108.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
108.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: When you were holed up in Wyrm's Rock, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?

8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
8.text: Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered your father like the devil you are.

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: Well played, Florrick. But you will not stand in my way - the city is mine by rights.

80.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
80.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

71.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

34.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
34.text: The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.NodeContext: Please include Florricking Spitting (motion and sound) before delivering the line.

101.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
101.text: I trusted you. I believed in you.
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: Florrick, what are you on about - what is this?
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

77.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
77.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

70.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
70.text: You mean to make the city bow to you and you alone!
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

37.speaker: Wyll
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

113.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
113.text: Save it. My duty is to Baldur's Gate - and it holds no place for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

72.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

1.speaker: Wyll
1.text: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: Father's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing I could do!
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: She lied to you, Florrick. I did everything in my power to get my father to safety!
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

27.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
27.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

5.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

76.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
76.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

4.speaker: Wyll
4.text: Florrick. Mizora is a devil; I am my father's son. Will you really trust her word over mine?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

133.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

102.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
102.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

15.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
15.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
13.text: Wyll, there's something you must know. I should've told you sooner, but I'd hoped somehow your father would return to us.

98.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
98.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

96.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
96.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

85.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
85.text: Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I must seek you out and give you this message.

10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
10.text: Your father trained you in the ways of the great champions. You are to use those lessons to wake the wyrm under the city. He is oathbound to answer your call and come to our aid.

33.speaker: Wyll
33.text: Do you mean Ansur? He's naught but bones, Florrick. But his spirit has blessed me with power.

74.speaker: Wyll
74.text: Do you mean Ansur? The dragon is dead.

7.speaker: Wyll
7.text: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: It will be done. I will seek the wyrm. Together, we will strike down the Absolute.

90.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
90.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Florrick. I am my father's son. You know me. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?

57.speaker: Wyll
57.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.
